alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 1:01PM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Greenville and Spartanburg. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1256 PM EST, Gauge reports depicted areas of excessive runoff continuing to work south throughout the drainage basins of Greenville and Spartanburg Counties. Please remain wary of elevated stream and river levels this afternoon and lingering flooding of low-lying areas. This includes but is not limited to the Reedy, Enoree, Tyger, Pacolet and Lawson Fork basins. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
